content.txt: is an SMT Solver that can compute Craig interpolants for various theories. The solver is developed at the Chair of Software Engineering at the University of Freiburg.
The solver is written in Java and can be used on any operating system that supports Java Version 8 or above.
The solver reads input in SMTLIB Version 2.5 format.

The current version of supports interpolation for the combination of the quantifier-free fragments of the theories of uninterpreted functions, linear real arithmetic, linear integer arithmetic, and arrays including constant arrays.
needs a Java 8 JRE or above. No special hardware is necessary but depending on the input problem, a fast CPU and a good amount of RAM might be useful.

is developed by Jochen Hoenicke and Tanja Schindler in the context of the SIGSMCAP (SMT-based Interpolant Generation for Software ModelChecking of Array Programs) project, and by Alexander Nutz. If you have any questions, suggestions, or if you want to contribute, feel free to contact us. Previous contributors include Jürgen Christ.
Please use our github page to report bugs.
